title: Can/Should Cassiopeia "Grounding" ground a Yasuo's ult?
body:
I have no clue how this interaction goes, and before i risk it all in a live game, I'd like to see the take on this. 
Basically, if a team fight breaks out and Cassiopeia w's a Yasuo, and an enemy of yas' gets knocked up, would/should yas be able to blink to them considering it IS mobility.

replies.body: If Yasuo is standing in Cass's W then he won't be able to activate his ult, even if an ally of his knocks up a nearby enemy champion. Cass W works the same way as a root, so any spell that can't be cast while rooted should also be blocked by Miasma.

Something probably worth mentioning:

If the W is on the person knocked up, but Yasuo is outside the W, he can still use R to blink inside the W cloud, right?
(It still prevents him dashing everywhere after his ult ends, though, so not completely useless.)

He could, yes. Miasma stops you from using mobility effects from it, rather than limiting mobility effects to it. It also doesn't have any effect on dashes, leaps etc that are already in progress (contrast: Poppy W).

It will however interrupt channeled spells that can be interrupted by roots (e.g. Shen ult or Summoner Teleport).
out of curiosity, how would this affect udyrs dash from hitting an opponent in bear form? Udyr performs the tiniest dash before slugging his target, is that coded as a dash or is it something else?

Not certain about Udyr off the top of the head, we do have a few abilities that are extremely short range that are tagged so that they ignore movement restrictions. 

Elise, to respond to the question below, should be constrained though, she definitely covers enough distance with her Spider Q to qualify as a normal dash.

Someone asked on EU about Cass' grounded effect and her interaction with Rengar. Obviously I had to test it.

**Kitty can jump while grounded, but he can't while rooted.
Is this intended?**

Coding wise I know Kitty's jump is considered a basic attack, which is why it deals guaranteed damage

* This will negate/stop the damage.
  *  Untargetable
  * Invulnerable
* This will stop his dash
  * Negate his jump (displacement, zhonya, walls).
* This won't matter.
 * Flashing,
 * Dashing

Which led to more testing, grounded disables Kalista's passive, the closest ability I could find that resembles his 'jump' coding wise.

I'm not 100% certain, but I played a game as Garen vs Poppy just yesterday. Garen's Q has the same mini-dash as udyr's bear, and I did it inside Poppy anti-dash zone and wasn't bump. So I suppose that Udyr can bear slaps people inside Cass grounded zone and that it still works.
Her anti dash zone disables dashing in/out of the zone, doesn't affect dashing inside the zone.
I'm sorry, but you're wrong. Dashing inside the zone is totally prevented. Try Graves/Lucian dash to escape her when she's in melee range, and you'll be sorely disappointed.

'dash to escape'
You said it yourself, they were trying to dash out of the zone.

Think of it as a moving Veigar Cage

You'll be bump at the beginning of your dash, not at the moment where you cross the zone. You are wrong. It's not at all like a moving Veigar Cage, it doesn't effect only its limit, it effects the whole area. I'm not asking you to explain it to me, I'm telling you you have the wrong idea. Make a test in custom.
I believe udyr is a movement speed boost. I don't think it applies
this makes me wonder for elise as well.
right, same thing isnt it?
Question: How do Poppy's W and Veigar's E interact with Yasuo's ult? Is it a blink or a dash? (also, do blinks bypass Poppy's W or not?)

> [{quoted}](name=Icestar1186,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EsHk0MO4,comment-id=0003000100010001,timestamp=2016-05-27T00:34:16.448+0000)
>
> Question: How do Poppy's W and Veigar's E interact with Yasuo's ult? Is it a blink or a dash? (also, do blinks bypass Poppy's W or not?)

Yasuo ult is a blink, doesn't get effected.
Probably, don't think her W can stop his ulti in progress.

> [{quoted}](name=Bobloser3555,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EsHk0MO4,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2016-05-26T16:24:09.220+0000)
>
> Probably, don't think her W can stop his ulti in progress.

I'd like to test this. I thought I was able to cancel an in-progress tp channel with Miasma (unless the champion actually canceled their tp) which would imply that it would also cancel things like Fiddle and Shen ults which have a channel before the blink.
if she can indeed cancel those ults it would be op xD
That was my first thought too, but any single other hard CC interrupts them also so its not _Really_ that bad considering...

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EsHk0MO4,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-05-26T07:11:10.081+0000)
>
> If Yasuo is standing in Cass's W then he won't be able to activate his ult, even if an ally of his knocks up a nearby enemy champion. Cass W works the same way as a root, so any spell that can't be cast while rooted should also be blocked by Miasma.

Thanks! I was thinking along those lines, glad to know (I'll be taking Cass vs Yas from now on!)
Thanks.

> I have no clue how this interaction goes, and before i risk it all in a live game, I&#039;d like to see the take on this. 
> Basically, if a team fight breaks out and Cassiopeia w&#039;s a Yasuo, and an enemy of yas&#039; gets knocked up, would/should yas be able to blink to them considering it IS mobility.

blinks are not dashes I think 
you can flash out of cass miasma right?
you can't use any spell that would allow you to move from your positon. so basically it's a snare you can move around in.
that's actually the best description I've ever seen for grounded

> [{quoted}](name=Meriipu,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EsHk0MO4,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-05-26T04:22:12.562+0000)
>
> blinks are not dashes I think 
> you can flash out of cass miasma right?

No you can't.
I don't think so, pretty sure it blocks blinks.  If it doesn't then yas can ult.

> [{quoted}](name=Meriipu,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EsHk0MO4,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-05-26T04:22:12.562+0000)
>
> blinks are not dashes I think 
> you can flash out of cass miasma right?

You can't flash out of miasma.
and which way is Katarina facing when she ults?
it works with whichever way she started out facing IIRC

> [{quoted}](name=The Minion hunt,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EsHk0MO4,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-26T04:18:43.173+0000)
>
> and which way is Katarina facing when she ults?

I hate that mechanic. Whenever I play Cass vs Kat you've got a 33.3% chance to stun her when she uses her ult with your own ult.
I know that it'll stop a kat from jumping out, wouldn't that be the same code used for yas, just to the knock'd champ?

> [{quoted}](name=The Minion hunt,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EsHk0MO4,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-26T04:18:43.173+0000)
>
> and which way is Katarina facing when she ults?

rotating
Yasuo teleports to the his location, so it might be coded as a blink. It's hard to say without seeing it in action.
It is a blink, and it cannot be used while in her w
